Reviews.Title: “Nice 3* hotel near main attractions”
Reviews.Author: VadimBelousov
Reviews.Content: The real 3* twin-hotel (Menfis Tryp is only 20 meters right) just in the center. Quality breakfast. Only 20 minutes by step to Sol, or 25-30 minutes- to Prado. Early check in! We arrived at 10 am and received a room immediately. Free WiFi. Surrounded by a plenty of cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: kim j
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Tryp Washington, which looked more like a 2-star hotel rather than 3. The room was reasonably priced and adequate, with very effective air conditioning and an updated (but rather small) bathroom. The ambience of the hotel, however, is depressing - stark white walls that need painting, tattered carpeting in the hallways, a charge to use the computers, a very busy Gran Vía just outside. Even Plaza de España, only a 2-minute walk, had several large vacant and vandalized buildings surrounding it. Next time, we will look for a nicer hotel in a quieter part of the city, but will not return to the Tryp Washington.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Gracious reception”
Reviews.Author: Dr Grace L
Reviews.Content: TRYP Madrid Washington is located in the heart of Madrid where you can walk to the major tourist sites (Prado, Puerta del Sol). The nearest Metro station (Plaza de Espana) is just 2 minutes away. The room is clearn and a bit small, but with a spacious bathroom and a balcony. We are happy with it given the convenient location. Can't beat that. The reception is great and friendly. I left my monopod when I checked out on 4/5/12 Ten days later (4/14) after visiting Barcelona and Seville, I returned to Madrid to catch a flight back to the Yankeeland the following day. I returned to the hotel and asked the reception whether the hotel staff found my monopod. To my surprise, the reception checked with the lost and found department immediately and told me that they kept my monopod. It was returned to me right away. Conclusion: Pros: Great location, reasonable price (when you book it early enough), and friendly reception. Cons: Small rooms, need more and bigger elavators. It was a bit annoying in the morning as I was located in the 10th floor. The two small elavators were not sufficient enough to accommodate checkout customers and customers going for breakfast at the same time. On two occasions, I couldn't be bothered to wait and walk instead - from the 10th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: LinZPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel room to find my requested room for 3 people with 3 old exposed single box springs with mattresses and covered with a sheet each. not the nice inviting room pictured on their website. There were 2 blankets in the room. Looks like a 1-star hotel room. Room is not cramped, though bathroom is small. Low lighting so hard to use it for reading. Hotel building is run down and street outside it is dirty, strewn with trash.. Regretting the choice made by a booking agent as it was not a bargain.. Saw many other more inviting properties.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey 11th Floor Room, but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew P
Reviews.Content: Room was not big, neither was the bed, the bathroom and tv were big thou ! We had a noisey room on the 11th floor, I think the noise came from the a/c on the roof, vibrating onto ceiling and onto the headboard, sleeping was hard ! The room and hotel were clean. The location was good. The staff were only interested in booking you in and did not offer any advice on the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “No double beds”
Reviews.Author: tintbum
Reviews.Content: Books 3 months before arriving specifically stating I wanted a double bed. Arrived to see 2 single beds, went down stairs to get a room with a double bed , the 2 ppl at the desk said there isn't any and they are all booked out. They said I should of booked earlier and said I didn't book it 3 months ago. I asked for some double bed sheets to make the singles join together. They refused! I asked them how many rooms they had with dbl beds, they said only 1 on each floor! A hotel that has only 1 double bed on each floor?! And NO dbl bed sheets. There were no chairs to sit on wither, just a small round table. Which is useless if you don't have any chairs to sit on. Had to sit on the bed all the time. There was no gym as advertised. No coffee or tea facilities. NO internet or computer. (it was broken) Don't give these rude ppl your business, stay somewhere else, and don't book more than one night anywhere just in case you want to leave. We were stuck there for 5 days! Hated it. Hated the attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value”
Reviews.Author: elledeelondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a break with my boyfriend....got a good rate on lastminute.com, which sold the hotel as one of their 'secret hotel' deals where you don't find out the name until after you've booked and paid. We were very pleasantly surprised! Hotel in perfect location, from where you can walk everywhere in the city centre (we only took the metro twice- to go to the Bernabeu stadium, and to/from the airport). The room was very clean, bathroom was nice, lovely Bang & Olufsen tv in room and even though we were at the front of the hotel, there was very little noise from the street. We didn't have the breakfast as lots of other little cafes you can go to (especially the Museo del Jamon next door which we loved for serrano ham baguettes and coffees at €1 each) but based on my experience I'd definitely stay at the hotel again! Only downside= we got a twin, not a double bed, although if we had asked after checking in they may have changed the room for us, so our fault, not theirs!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: tiggerck33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, 2 minutes walk from the metro station, and 10 minutes in the other direction from the shopping/eating centre of the city. The reception staff were always helpful and polite. The rooms are clean and the ones at the front and the back of the building are a decent size. Make sure you are not given a smaller room which opens onto the internal "courtyard" ( this is more of an open air chimney) and if you get one of those and have the unfortune to be on one of the lower floors, it is like sleeping in a cave! Even in the day you need the light on to see where you are going in the room. I got one of those, and after the first night, asked if I could change; which was not a problem. Breakfast was timely and plenty of choice. Ask the reception if there are holiday/festival days during the week so you don't get caught out as breakfast starts later on those days as with Sundays. If you are going close to the summer months and it is still hot (in comparison to British climate) a hotel with a pool may be advisable though.... the outdoor ones in Madrid only open during the summer holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: lpkspain
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered a great location for sight seeing, easy access to the Metro (subway/underground) and Starbucks! The room, although basic, was clean, cool (a big plus because it´s hot in Madrid in the summer) and a good size. The bathroom was nice, clean and ample. The reception staff was helpful and polite. An excellent value if you just want a cool, clean place to rest while visiting the wonderful city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “I'll try something else next time!”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoV
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and pretty clean however the air conditioning system was very loud even when you swtch it off! I asked to change room thinking it was a problem only in my room, but it was exactly the same in the other room. The hotel has no bar and the breakfast wasn't the greatest. Very good position for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad experience”
Reviews.Author: lousifers
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nites. The toilet should be smaller to make the room bigger. If not include the nice toilet, the room itself is 2-star quality. The receptionists talked to me nicely, but somehow I got bad luck. First day I asked a receptionist where to eat Paella. She gave me address and marked it on the map, turning out that both are wrong. I got to the very point on the map and the point of the address (different places btw). The next day, we got out of the room at 10:30AM, coming back to get something at 5PM, but the room not made up yet. Got to tell them to do. On the day back, the man receptionist called taxi for us, but he circled around and then charged us 45euro.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very friendly hotel receptionists”
Reviews.Author: Tamuda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in the busy street of Gran Via, at a very short walking distance from the blue-line metro station of Plaza de España. The iconic landmarks of Madrid such as Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol are also located at a walking distance from the hotel. I was given an individual room not facing the Gran Via street, so I didn't hear any traffic noise. However, the room was too small that you can hardly move around without bumping into furniture. Also, there was a desk in the room without a chair. The hotel offers an in-room private safety box, where you can store your passport and valuable items. The front desk receptionists were very friendly, particularly the guy who who works in the morning shift. The breakfast room is nice overlooking Gran Via street, where a full hot & cold breakfast buffet is served every morning. Based on the layout, it seems to me that the hotel was a residential building in the past that was converted into a hotel. The only thing that annoyed me during my stay in this hotel is some Spanish people talking loud in the hallway instead of going inside their room and also the maid who starts vacuuming at 9:00 a.m. and I think this is due to the fact that the hotel check-in time starts at noon.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, nice location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cadi_cunha
Reviews.Content: Right in the Grand Via, very close to Plaza España and the subway. Careful not to miss the tiny entrance. Average 3* hotel with dated rooms, but great staff and general value. We were upgraded to a family room with Gran Via view, which was nice - the double layered windows are almost 100% effective. Some reviews say the beds are hard, but had absolutely no problem with it. The TV set was probably from the 90s, but Bang & Olufsen, which I found very funny. Very good breakfast with lots of options. They charge EUR8 for 24h wi-fi Internet access, but it was broken for 3 of my 5 days stay. Elevator can take too long sometimes. If you're on a budget and can get a nice rate, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: IlikeSpain
Reviews.Content: The location is great, (about 15 mins walk to the Palace), the staff at breakfast very friendly. The buffet breakfast was very good. The room was not fancy, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Juan_Alejandro
Reviews.Content: Great location and price not to high. Even it is on Gran Via, I got a room interior view - no very nice - but quiet.... Get enroll to MAS hotel program so you can enjoy a 2x1 breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Not flashy, but perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Enoch_Sneed
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as abase for a exploring the centre of Madrid and it did all we wanted. The rooms were clean, the staff were helpful, the breakfast was good. There is nothing luxurious here but all the sights of Madrid are in walking distance, and the nearest Metro station (best/cheapest way to travel from the airport) is a few hundred metres away in Plaza España. If you want an economic base close to sights, shops, theatres, etc., this is as good as anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KSadvisor
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 35 mins on Metro from the airport, centre of town with main sites walking distance, metro station 30 seconds walk. room very clean, decent shower and toilet. basic decor. Staff spoke decent English and very helpful. I didn't try the food. lots of restaurants and bars near by. stayed on room away from main road so had good sleep. Overall would recommend as a good 3* and great location.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel at 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: lindyloohs
Reviews.Content: If we'd have wanted a budget hotel we'd have paid a lot less. I've stayed at much better Travel Lodges for a lot less. At 118 euros a night this hotel did not live up to its price tag. We'd booked a double bed and got twin beds. When we pointed out that we'd booked a double room, they said there was only one double-bedded room on each floor. We asked for some double sheets so that we could turn the twin beds into a double, but apparently they had none spare!. Pretty odd stats for a 5/6 floor hotel with a 115 rooms. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, the curtains were ripped and hanging off the rail. Despite advertising a bar, small gym and lounge we searched the place and couldn't find any of these. There was a vending kiosk in a room with some basic tables and chairs - the coffee and tea from this kiosk weren't free either. Did we leave a tip? No but I'd like to offer one now. While this doesn't apply to all the staff, It's a small reception area and a bit of customer care training wouldn't go amiss - smile, say hello and look like you care that your customers are paying your wages. We got no information about facilities on arrival and had to request some info as there was none in the room either. It was our first trip to Madrid and our experience tainted our stay and view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: chipalkatti
Reviews.Content: Almost Everything....fantastic location - hard to beat in Gran Via. Also, your receptionists are one the kindest I have ever met - always smiling and ready with the information you need. I think the carpet at the turnstil (entrace) needs to be changed since I was a bit scared when I saw that. Also, the shower heads and shower curtains need to be changed. Also, the crowds coming in at 4 AM in the morning from the party need to be told to keep their voices down, but it was probably due to the world cup - Everything else was pretty much perfect. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: CarolynG50
Reviews.Content: Traveled with husband and 2 teenage sons to visit our daughter who is working in Madrid. I think the entire average October rainfall fell on the Saturday! We had a BA deal so breakfast was included and very good indeed.Easy to find your way around,walk to the Palacio Royal via Plaza Espana, then onto Plaza Mayor ,across to Plaza Santa Ana where the cafes are nicer and cheaper, especially if the weather is good. Its then not far to Sol and then on to the Prado, and Retiro Park.,Obviously you can take a couple of days or more to do this plus the Reina Sofia and so many more.The shopping is great, something to suit everyone. The trip to Santiago Bernabeu was surprisingly interestinging despite me hating football. The metro is clean fast and unbelievably cheap.The hotel was clean, comfortable with cheerful staff. The free safe was good, I find it strange that wifi is free in the small hostales but dear in the hotels. Yes it was a bit noisy but what on earth do people expect if they stay on the main Madrid High Street!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent quality/price relation!”
Reviews.Author: lucasousa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty much what I expected. When you get a Tryp hotel you know what you are getting and this was the case. I had a very good price for 4 nights in this hotel. It's very well located in Gran Via close to the metro and to some of the touristic points of Madrid. The room is confortamble and spacious and the breakfast was normal. So, because of the price I would definitely advise to book this hotel as a very good starting point to your Madrid visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: hanburger999
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Tryp Washington and had a fantastic time. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and very helpful. The hotel is located on Gran Via, which is the main road running through the city. It's within minutes walk of the main shops and bar areas. It's also very near to the Royal Palace, which I would strongly recommend visiting. The city itself is a great place to visit. It's got everything, nice restaurants, bars, galleries etc. and is less touristy than Barcelona. I was surprised by how cheap it was too- around 3 euros for breakfast and you can get a decent meal with a drink for only 15 euros. We also took a day trip out to Toledo, which again I'd strongly recommend doing. It's worth booking train tickets online first though as we found the queue in the train station was horrific! All in all, a great hotel and a fantastic city!!

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the staff”
Reviews.Author: p_mcgough
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying the room was pleasant and the household cleaners were punctual and efficient. Unfortunately, other aspects of the staffing let much to be desired. On arrival I found the safe did not work. After several trips up and down in the very slow lift during which I was repeatedly told I just wasn't operating it right we agreed it did not in fact work. But noone could look at it for several days. So I had to leave my valuables/passport etc at the front desk which was a worry. Next evening I was pickpocketed in a busy crowd. Not the hotel's fault by any means! However when I went to call and cancel my cards/iphone, I found themake a call to room phone woukl not make calls to UK. So up and down again to reception, where I was repeatedly told I was not using it right and it was fine. As you see, I have never used a phone in my life before now and have no concept of how to press 0 to get an external line! Finally the guy on the desk let me make 2 calls, very grudgingly, from the lobby. Telling me all the time it was not their problem and go see the police. Which I did, but only after cancelling my cards of course! No more calls were allowed, as as far as he was concerned I could simply use the phone in my room. Next day I set about trying to contact friends and arrange emergency cash. New staff on the desk again refusing to believe I was not too stupid to use a phone, so it was not until after 2pm that a technician arrived - and then went away to get my phone reconnected as the number was 'bad'. (He also fixed my safe!) Upshot was that it was already too late to get a wire transfer, so a day wasted going up and down in the lift, being patronised and another night with no cash. And not the slightest sign of an apology or even recognition that the staff had been useless and lazy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, easy walking distances”
Reviews.Author: bunto
Reviews.Content: Spents 5 great days, weather disapointingly cool for May, rained some days but at least we got there! Edinburgh airport was closed the day before we left due to the volcanic ash. Our room was spacious and looked out onto the Gran Via, noise no problem as windows are well double glazed. We were offered a good deal on breakfast and found it was very good, lots of choice and friendly staff keep everything well replenished. From Gran Via we could walk to Plaza de Sol in 15 mins., then Plaza Mayor is only 5 mins. further. We met with Spanish friends some days, but other times armed with a good guide book most places are easy to find. As this was our 3rd visit to Madrid we went to the bull fighting with a Canadien friend. A brilliant experience but once is enough, too cruel and too long, 6 bulls slaughtered in total! Would stay in a Tryp hotel again, there are quite a few located around Gran Via. Would also recommend Room Mates hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Burnzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located, within walking ditance to metro stations and bus stops. Located on Gran Via it was within walking distance of Plaza del Sol. The hotel rooms were modern and clean and had adequate space for two people. Rooms that face Gran Via are a bit noisy, so you have to keep the windows closed during the night. The staff, although a bit aloof will help you when you request help. The breakfast, which was not included in the room rate, was generous but a bit pricey. There are cafes in the area where you can get breakfast for half the price. BUT...this hotel is right next store to a restaurant called de Maria where they serve the best Creole Empanadas in the world. So, carnal urges can be met right next door !!! I would go back to this hotel, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and location = good value”
Reviews.Author: quark
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Tryp Washington in Madrid for 4 nights in November. Overall we thought the hotel was an excellent value. The room was large and comfortable with a nice sized bathroom, which had a tub. A nice warm bubble bath was a treat after having walked around Barcelona and Madrid for hours and days on end. Plus the room had the darkening shades so sleeping a little late was easy and considering we were on the Gran Via the room was fairly quiet. The staff was pleasant and the location was very good. We walked to many of the sites but we were also close to a few metro lines. The hotel is also right next door to a Museo del Jamon where we had breakfast most mornings. It was just down the way too from a seafood restaurant (Can’t remember the name but it was maybe a block away on Gran Via) where we had breakfast one morning. I had the most delicious tortillas de patatas . It was so good I rank it up there with one of the best things I ate in Spain. I wish we had eaten at this restaurant more. My only complaint about the hotel was the Internet access. It was fairly expensive and I could never get into my email but this is minor compared to how much we liked everything else about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: guiltypleasure
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central for most places but if you want to be near the Prado then this hotel is not for you. The hotel is based on a main very touristy road but we were in a room round the back of a hotel so we did not get much noise (we took earplugs also!) The view was not fantastic (supermarkets etc) but I did not really book the room to sit and gaze out of the window all day. The shower was lovely and the room clean so I would recommend it as long as the room is not overlooking the main road

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff, bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Locheriboll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a British Airways fly and stay deal, so breakfast was included. We were there for a very unusually hot spell in October so the air conditioning had been turned off and could not be turned back on. It was fine with the bedroom and bathroom windows open, but like that ,earplus were a must....then okay. We were on the 11th floor and with the window shut, it wasn't too noisy, but the sirens in Madrid are horrendous even with earplugs! Unlike some others here, we found the staff spoke great English and were super-helpful. We also found the room and bed comfortable and the marble bathroom palatial! Since we weren't "paying" for breakfast, it seemed fine. If I'd been paying 27 euros I might not have been so pleased. I'd definitely stay here again. WARNING: My husband had his wallet lifted on the way from the airport to the hotel, even though we had been warned and were watching out. He had actually removed everything except 3 Bandaids, so they must have been disappointed, but still, he lost a nice wallet and had the attendant inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation”
Reviews.Author: catOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Tryp washington in Madrid. Loacated on the Grand Via steps from Plaza de Espana Metro. Easily reached from the airportm changing trains once. Staff friendly and very helpful. Breafast was good. A good variety of breads, cereals, fruits, egg, bacon etc. Rooms are clean and spaceous with hairdyer. I had read that the airconditoner did not work but our did. you have to ensure your windows are clsoed properly or the A/C will not come on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Diltiazem
Reviews.Content: Booked the Tryp Washington trough Sol Melia site, and was granted with a fantastic rate of 45€/night. This prooved to be a fantastic value for money as the hotel is placed in the Gran Via, a few steps away from "Plaza de España" metro station and 30 minutes from Barajas International Airport using the metro. So it's location is perfect if the goal of your trip is sightseeing. The rooms are spatious and well kept, I would say pretty standard for a 3 star. The staff at reception were allways nice and available to help. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on it's quality. The only downside was that we stayed in a room that faced a lateral street were a local market is held, and the noise started very early in the morning. Also be aware that this seems to be an area were there are professional pickpocketers, so pay attention to your stuff in restaurants, cafes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for good value first time sightseeing in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SJP20
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from our first trip to Madrid. £20.00 return Ryan air cheapy, we wanted a good value hotel to keep the cost as low as possible. Bkd hotel using GMTV website after trawling through loads of sites and after calling Sol Melia direct, GMTV website offered the best deal. Flt landed 1230am & Metro (underground) is only open from 0630 - 0130am so as 1st time to Madrid & didn't know where we were going we got a taxi to the hotel. 20-30 minute ride costs about 30 euros. We enjoyed the taxi ride it gave us a good view of the city and was interesting. However if you are on a budget I would recommend if you get to Madrid at anytime including our flight which got there at 1230 that you do take the plunge and try the Metro it takes about 1/2 hour although daunting at first it is so cheap only 2 euros from the airport to right to the centre of Madrid. The Metro maps are clear and easy to use, the ticket machines are easy to use and the staff that work there are friendly and helpful. We found Madrid very much like New York the Hotel is ideally located right on the Gran Via, There is no grand entrance simply a doorway but it is clean and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We saw many different staff during the 4 night stay and every one of them was extremely helpful. The rooms and clean and fine with a TV and hairdryer. They have Dove cream soap dispensers in the bathroom for use in the shower and Lux cream soap dispensers by the sink. So no need for soap (good to know if you want to cut down on liquids and stuff in your luggage) useful for us as we just did the 10kg handluggage free of charge on Ryan air, so not having to take a hairdryer was good. We had room 807 - 8th floor. Good view if you dared to look out of the windows which are very low if you open them and I would be a touch concerned if I had kids so if you take kids, keep the window locked and closed. The air con worked fab but only if the window was properly closed, so for other reviews I read about aircon not working, maybe their window wasn't closed properly. We didn't add breakfast to our booking and if you are not getting a very cheap deal don't, you can get breakfast ie toast, juice and coffee or eggs, bacon and toast juice and coffee for around 2euros -5 euros in all the nearby cafes. I believe the hotel charges 12 euros for a buffet breakfast, so if you like a big hearty breakfast then fine, but if not you can get away with a couple of euros at either Nebraska turn left walked a few yards up the road and cross over or in the tapas cafes on the same side of the road. The restaurant Diabocca turn left and cross the road but slightly further up is a great Italian and especially if you like to be served your food properly with a nice wine list. We found a shortage of high quality restaurants, but if you love Tapas (as you should do if you are visiting Spain) you will be fine. Beware the Plaza Mayor restaurants in the square can be a rip off for Tapas because of the setting, have a drink there but eat elsewhere - we had a meal there and it was our worst of the stay, you get better meals and restaurants away from the tourist attractions. Do the open top bus tour you can get the tickets in the hotel its 17euros for 1 day (includes both red and blue route) and can get on or off as many times as you like and it will give you a great sense or where everything is in Madrid. We brough the 2 day ticket for 21 euros - after that we became experts on the Metro, only 1 euro for each journey whereever you go in the city! great value. By the way there is a spa next door to the hotel which you can use for 17 euros a day but sometimes they have special offers on for afternoon use. Go in and ask. There is a pool on top of the hotel emperado but they charge 30 euros for a day if you are not hotel residents, not worth it. If you have time you can get the Metro up to Charmartin and go to the Tryp Centro North and use their pool - you need 10euros for a deposit for towels and its a bit concrete jungle, but if you really need to cool off you can do this, but I had a a note of the fact that I could do this from the GMTV booking so check you get the same deal with whoever you book with. Loved Madrid, although 3 nights would have been enough for us. I don't really do museaums and Art Gallerys, the parks are lovely the shops quite good and its clean (loads of graffiti though) If you are out passed Midnight the streets around the Gran Via have tons of prostitutes working who will approach any man that walks passed! Was a bit daunting the first night we got there when we went out for a late drink. I thought it was all very seedy, but by the next day you would never know that went on at night! I thought there would be more nightlife but it seemed to quite down by 1.00am ish. Street noise - loads of it from the hotel, but when you are in any City like New York, Madrid, London etc you expect that from a well located hotel, you get used to it. Or don't book a hotel with a central location and travel in to do your sightseeing! One thing we were amazed at is the young Spanish people - on a Sunday we couldn't believe how many of them fill the boot of their car with Booze and just park up anywhere they can and have a sort of street party, it was a bit scarey really, although we were at the Tryp Norte Central - using the pool when we saw this. So I don't know if it happens in the city much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... The best location”
Reviews.Author: RitaBarrela
Reviews.Content: For a 3* hotel I tought it was nice. No noise coming from the Gran Via. Great for a few days in Madrid. Very very cheap for the kind of service and the incredible location. Right in the city center, near everything. Thought that doesn't boddered me much the air conditioning was broken. A suggestion: In Madrid forget about the metro and just walk.......

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, strongly recommend, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Blondie7831
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Washington having booked their 3 night stay deal. We paid between us just under 170 euros for the three nights which included a fabulous breakfast. This included sausages, bacon, eggs, cheeses, tomotoes, pastries, cereal, yoghurts, fruit, hot and cold drinks all at your disposal. The hotel is nearest to the Plaza de Espana Metro station but is easily within walking distance of alot of sites i.e. 10 min walk from Plaza Mayor where shopping, eating and drinking is great!! There was some outside noise at night which was a little disturbing but being in such a vibrant and lively city I believe that this should be expected. I would still recommend the hotel to anyone and stay there again. Other than that the room and bathroom were clean with ample space.

Reviews.Title: “its ok, although the Tryp Rex is probably more comfortable on same street”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Gran via by Plaza de Espana metro station on line 10 which is handy if travelling from the airport as you only have to change once at Nuevos Ministerios. We had stayed at the Tryp Rex 10 days earlier on arrival into Madrid and this is located on the same street. The hotel is next but one to the Tryp Menfis so potential to get a bit confused with so many hotels of the same brand. If I am honest i did actually prefer the Rex inspite of it being an older hotel. There is nothing particuarly wrong with this hotel however, it is a solid 3 star property. Rooms have wooden floors but the room i was given overlooking Gran Via on the 7th floor was on the small side. The Bathroom was claustrophobic too with a tiny shower/bath. The room I was given at the Rex was a lot bigger. Air Conditioning in the room worked a treat, in fact so much so I had to turn it off after 5 mins becuase it was so cold in the room and it was 40 degrees outside. Safe in the room, although this did not work. Again vending machines on the 1st floor with icebox and complimentary newspapers. Its an ok hotel, and good value for 41 euro a night paid here.

Reviews.Title: “Tryp Washington- would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: LFK
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay in the Tryp Washington in Madrid. The hotel is on the very busy Gran Via, surrounded by hotels, restaurants, shops and theatres. It's close to the Plaza de Espana and The Palacio Real and less than 5 minute walk to the nearest metro. I asked for (and got) a quiet room on the 8th floor round the back of the hotel which also had a small balcony. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and spoke english, the room was large and clean and the bed very comfortable. On the Saturday night the hotel was busy and noisy with revellers returning at all hours, the other nights were much quieter. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but I suggest the Cafe Nebraska (turn right, cross the road) where you can get a great breakfast from 2 Euros. The metro was easy 1 E per journey or 10 for 8.40E, but watch out for drunks and pickpockets in the central stations. The Madrid Vision open top tour bus, leaves from a stop near the hotel and is good value and a great way to see Madrid as it stops at all the major attractions, if like me you have difficulty walking. One final tip the hotel is part of the Sol Melia Group- check their website for special deals.

Reviews.Title: “Mrs”
Reviews.Author: palmeyra
Reviews.Content: Fifty yards from 'Plaza de España' underground, good breakfast, excellent situation. If you want quiet at night ask for an interior room . .no view, but quiet. Otherwise, a good view over the Gran Vía. Breakfast good. Internet didn't work on the second day we were there, but I believe this is unusual. Machines for water, drinks, sandwiches etc. at a reasonable price. No restaurant apart from breakfast, but plenty of places nearby. We paid 56 euros including breakfast, a special Solmelia offer. Worth more than this and usually would be more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: amorrow7
Reviews.Content: Location: good location in central Madrid, very close to a Metro station. The Gran Via area is commercial (there is a TGI Fridays and a KFC nearby), but it's a close walk to less touristy restaurants near Puerta Del Sol or the Chueca area, etc. Room: Our room was clean and relatively modern. Nothing fancy. Nice sized bathroom for a European hotel. The air conditioning didn't work very well, even when we got a second key and left the key in the wall slot to keep the AC running while we were out. Luckily, it wasn't that hot while we were there, and our window opened onto an airshaft that wasn't too noisy. Our friends had a room on the 10th floor that had a balcony (but no chairs on the balcony). Their room was near some sort of vent from a kitchen, and they said their room smelled of food, even if they'd kept the windows closed. At night, if they left their windows open, they were awoken by loud people leaving the club that faced the alley behind the hotel. No free wifi. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel. Our room was non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Jmuya
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel that have everything one needs for a touristic stay in Madrid! Very central, in Gran Via, close to Plaza España, in an area full of cinemas, theaters and shopping! We are a 30 something couple travellers (and have tried from hostels to 4 star hotels) and this hotel seemed great and comfortable! The stuff was helpfull. We didin´t choose to have breakfast in the hotel but anyway around there are some very nice places to get the breakfast you want! In General very good for starting to enjoy a beautiful city like Madrid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lindy4130
Reviews.Content: Great Breakfast and friendly, helpful staff. Room was a good size and well presented. Noise was a small issue but may have been due to the time coinciding with New Year and Wise Men coming.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid”
Reviews.Author: VicM
Reviews.Content: A neat clean and tidy hotel. The room did not have a bar fridge, so if you want to buy perishable goods (milk, cheese etc) there is no where to store them. We booked room without breakfast - breakfast was an extra Euro 12 per person, a bit rich. The hotel is in a good location, on one of the main streets of Madrid, with metro only minutes away. Keep away from restaurants like "VIPS" they are overpriced for what you get. Sandman offer a free (he does ask for a voluntary tip / donation at the end) 3.5 hour walking tour of Madrid which is not bad and gives you a good overview of the city and its history. You can find the tour at Sol (Sol metro station) in the centre square.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: jospud
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean but very basic, there was no lounge and bar as advertised. The room and bathroom were adequately sized but the lighting was very poor at night, not enough lighting to see what you were doing especially in the bathroom where there was no light over the bath. The staff were not what you would call exactly friendly, but would help if you asked. The one good thing was the breakfast which was good for a 3 star hotel and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: browneyes30
Reviews.Content: It was very clean, central, eat as much as you like breakfast, safe. Our room was spotless after the cleaners. The staff were very friendly towards my 1 year old nephew which he loved! He got plenty of attention! Just a walk away from the shopping street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Shawna00
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind this hotel is rated 3 stars. For the cost and great location I recommend this place. Staff was great! Beds were hard. Rooms were clean. I saw 2 bugs in the bathroom room, like those silver fish thingys.

Reviews.Title: “marvellous little spot and fab city”
Reviews.Author: mugseybear
Reviews.Content: four of us stayed here in july for 5days, had a little problem at start when we went to the hotel and the receptionist said there was no booking for any of us, even though it had been paid online and we had the confirmation of the booking with us. he was somewhat ignorant but after a little while of arguing our case, he agreed that yes there was a booking for us thank god!! it was nearly a disaster but after this things just got better and better. from the outside the hotel does not look like much but looks are decieving, inside this hotel is beautiful,lovely marble floors and the rooms are spacious with great ensuites, and the rooms are cleaned every day, it is really nice inside. location is also marvellous its along the gran via in madrid and it is close to everything. what a great street that is. everything is close to it like tgi fridays is 2 doors down with fab food,lots of diners, cafes , pubs and great little shops where i purchased many a cheap handbag which were class. its expensive enough but we got taxis everywer taxis are always on the button and theres lots of them so yal never be stuck, we went to the hard rock cafe a few nites aswell-yal need a taxi to it. went to irish pubs such as the dubliners where we met lots of irish lads and had a great time!! highlight of madrid was going to the warner bros theme park!! ya must not go to madrid without visiting this!! ya need to get a train out to it cos it is in the middle of the country side train takes ya there inabout an hour tip is go early in the morning and make a day out ofit-tickets in to the park or summit like 32euro for a whole day and ya can go on any ride with this. when we went, it was scorching hot and the queues to get on the water rides were massive but worth it in the end. be warned food in this park is very expensive for what you get so eat a good breakfast or take lunch with u perhaps!! madrid is a great city and this hotel set us up for a great week with lovely parks and fountains to relax by-such a clean city-streets are powerhosed down every night!!could not believe it!!! its great loved it and we will be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Can improve”
Reviews.Author: Just-reviews
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from here I was sure that I would find a good located hotel, friendly staff and clean rooms. For this price it is a good choice but if you are the sort of person that will start checking the room details, you will get disappointed. The walls need to be repainted and some details fixed, like air conditioning and windows vedation. There is a disco at the back corner and the Madrilhenos start to have fun around 4 am and if you are the sort of person that can be easily awake you will get...stressed. The room that we got smells like a restaurant kitchen - urgh - but the one that the oder friends were didn`t. All in all, its up to you...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely adequate facilities, good location”
Reviews.Author: slowtraveller
Reviews.Content: We have picked this hotel for our stay in July based on reviews read here and are really glad we did. The room was on the smallish side but we spent so little time indoors that it did not count. Room faced the street - no problem for us, we actually liked it, but if you're a very light sleeper, request one that does not because some street noise will be heard even with the double windows. Good points: good location, close to transportation, variate and tasty breakfast menu, clean room, the air conditioning worked just fine, nice bathroom with plenty of water pressure and HUGE bath towels. Gripes: minor - the internet connection was very, very slow and the management really scrimped on toiletries - only liquid soap was available in two wall-mounted receptacles - one by the sink, one by the bathtub. All in all a good experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MGSydney
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel only because it was the cheapest for the central location that was available at the time. I can't compare to any others in Spain but have stayed in hotels all over Europe and thought this was good value. The location is very good and close to most of Madrid's main attractions, and close to two Metro stations. The staff were friendly and willing to help, and most of the reception staff speak English. The room and bathroom standard was good for the price. Our rate did not include breakfast but there are many good cafes nearby (avoid Gran Via itself if you want real value). I think this is well worth considering, especially if you can get a good deal on the rate. I would stay here again. The main problem would be the lack of luggage storage. It was not an issue for me but my friends had a later flight and there is no facility to store even small bags for a few hours. This seems very strange. Almost all hotels of all prices even cheap hostels these days have luggage storage rooms! Another point to note is that complimentary newspapers are delivered but only in Spanish. It's a nice touch but not that useful for non Spanish speakers!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovec123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location, it's literally on the high street next to all the big name shops, it's also a seconds walk from the metro. I would say this is more like a 4 star hotel than a 3 star and the staff are fantastic. The reception staff are so helpful and go out of their way to book things for you and find alternatives. The breakfast buffet is great too. I would definately stay here again, it's value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: KCorner
Reviews.Content: Average tourist hotel (nice bathroom). If you WANT to be a tourist and stay on Oxford Street or Times Square then this place is fine. It's clean, comfortable and has reasonable facilities but it's not exactly a home from home. We thought the location was awful, all the restaurants and shops surrounding the hotel are geared at tourists (and therefore charge tourist rates and are full of teenage tour-groups!!). There's also the red light district, only 2 mins walk from the front door (maybe in Amsterdam this is a good thing, we found it to be scary in Madrid).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, well above average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: heyjude50
Reviews.Content: I can see that this hotel has not been reviewed in some time, possibly because of the construction that was taking place earlier - please do not let that hold you back - this is a great place to stay. We stayed there our last night in Spain. The price, 65 euros, was unbeatable. The room was very large, clean, well furnished, and modern; the desk staff were very friendly and helpful ( we had to leave at 4am for our flight and they were very helpful), parking is close by, and the neighborhood is terrific. The metro is right at the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Violet18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March and were very pleased with the standard of the rooms and the cleanliness. The staff on reception were very helpful and spoke good English. The hotel is situated at the bottom of the Gran Via and very near the metro and the open top bus stop. The breakfast was brilliant with plenty of choice including hot food. We were on the ninth floor and had one room at the front which had very good sound insulation as the road is busy all night. The room at the back had a lovely view over the rooftops but was noisy from the fruit and veg market. There seemed to be a club round there somewhere as well as the street was full of people even at 4 in the morning. Earplugs were very useful. There are plenty of restaurants on the Gran Via, some better than others. We wnt to the cheap and cheerful Museo de Jamon next door but we weren't very cheerful when we came out. Thank goodness for Burger King!!

Reviews.Title: “4 star for the price of a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: martindka
Reviews.Content: Positive Great hotel, very central location at Gran Via. Large rooms, spotless clean. 'Double window' so when it's closed you don't hear all he noise from Gran Via at all, this also helps keep out the warm in the summer time, when it get's really hot. Great breakfeast buffet. Negatives: Service at the reception is not good at all. Very arrogant personal, they barely notice you. It's strictly business, but then again it's a large hotel. If you like personal contact at the hotel you are staying at, this is not the place..

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Globetrottin_Grannie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tryp Washington My husband and I stayed here for less than 12 hours in September. We got in about 11.00pm and checked out at 7.30 the next morning to join a tour. The front of the building was scaffolded and entrance was through next door. The room was very nice and the bed large and comfortable. Bathroom was recently renovated and appealing, attractive ochre coloured tiles. Toiletries, shower cap provided (not always the case in Spain) water pressure was terrific. Despite the early start next morning breakfast room was up and running, good variety of hot and cold stuff. All staff we dealt with was friendly and efficient and we wished we had booked here again for our return to Madrid 13 days later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CeriP
Reviews.Content: we have just got back after spending 4 nights at the tryp washington hotel. it was a very friendly, spotlessly clean and central hotel with a fantastic HUGE buffet breakfast! The breakfast was open until 11am every day and you could have as much food as you wanted which was essential after too much rioja the night before!! we walked everywhere to all the major sites and lively tapas places and bars easily from the hotel and always felt safe even late at night/early hours of the morning. the metro which was a euro was also handily next to the hotel. we had an excellent time in madrid and recommend it and the hotel to anyone. only thing i would mention is the noise from the road - we were on the 11th floor and though rioja/cerveza wiped out the noise most nights, one night it was unbearable. I'd take earplugs if you're a light sleeper!!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: shihitemuslim
Reviews.Content: We received a great rate on priceline. The rooms look rather old. The restrooms were renovated. The hallways had an odor. The room was however very clean. We enjoyed the location. It was right next to the subway station and close to major tourist attraction. Everything you would like to see is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maya_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp from the 18th till the 22nd of august 2006, and really enjoyed our stay! I recently posted a view from the Eduardo VII in Lisbon, and I have to tell you, I was really suprised, because the Tryp Washington has also 3 stars, but was much better compared to the Eduardo! The room was very nice, the bathroom very modern and clean, the view over Gran Via is great and the walking distance to the touristic locations and shopping areas is very short! We took the metro to our hotel, and it went very well, although there are some constructions in the metro system, so we had to change two instead of one time! The breakfast at the Tryp Washington blew us away (compared to the Eduardo), there are so many choices in food, beverage and sweets! I read in some statements about the entrance hall being closed, so it was no suprise for us! We just checked in at the 4 stars Tryp next door! The hotels are connected, so that was no problem! The front desk staff was very halpful and friendly (in contrast to the Eduardo in Lisbon)! If you ever get to Madrid have lunch at the Gula Gula at Gran Via 1! It's a fun restaurant with fancy food! Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “The Tryp Washington Madrid--a Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Washington Hotel is one of those diamonds in the rough that shine only when you clear away the dust. Demanding travelers who require sumptuous elegance both inside and out and who rely on obsequious hotel staff fretting over their every need will not enjoy this hotel. Clearly, scaffolding surrounds the fascade of both it and its sister hotel, the Tryp Menfis, and access to the Washington remains through the Menfis. Those details aside, the Washington boasts that feature which is most important to American travelers in Europe--a moderately sized, comfortably modern room. Ours boasted a double bed, new hard wood flooring, plenty of closet and storage space, updated electricity (with three additional outlets for heating pads, curling irons, etc.), AIR CONDITIONING THAT WORKED, a mini bar, a comfortable marble bath with high water pressure showerhead and abundant hot water, and reliable maid service. Two metro lines are withing minutes of the property, which is located at the western end of the Gran Vía near Plaza de España, La Palacio Real, and the Opera district --where are located a range of lovely outdoor restaurants overlooking the palace. The hotel offers a breakfast service for 9E; however we preferred to purchase couissants from a local market and coffee from the (SURPRISE) Starbucks across the street, which saved both money and precious time. Another plus is that, though by no means out of the way, the hotel is significantly distanced from the throngs of tourists and Madrillenos that gather at venues such as Sol and Plaza de Cibeles and Plaza Mayor and Telefónica Gran Vía. Yet, those attractions are a comfortable stroll or convenient metro ride away. Also convenient is the presence, next door, of a local travel agency that offers inexpensive and informative day trips to locations beyond Madrid such as Toledo, Avila, Segovia, and El Escorial--which I heartily recommend to complete your central Spain experience. I heartily recommend the Tryp Washington and would not hesitate to stay there again upon future visits to this vibrant European capitol.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RandBrad
Reviews.Content: This is a very good place to stay, and reasonably priced (on Expedia). We booked the "Gran Via view room" but when we checked in, our view was to the unpleasant and noisy rear of the hotel. We got the room changed without difficulty. The sound-proofing of the windows on the Gran Via side is excellent (not so on the rear). The room was comfortable and the bathroom was better than we expected. The breakfast, which was included, was AWESOME, making the overall stay an excellent value! The location was great, and about 50 yards to the subway entrance, which is a great way to get around Madrid. We could walk to many of the sites we wanted to see. The fact that the Tryp Washington lobby was closed for renovation was no problem at all. You simply enter through the Tryp Menfis lobby, take the elevator to your floor, and walk through a doorway in the hallway to get to your room. The desk staff was friendly enough, but didn't exactly go out of their way to be welcoming or helpful. One note of warning (and not the fault of the hotel): it is impossible to get a taxi from this hotel to the train station. When the cabs pull over and hear that you're not going to the airport, they just drive off. If you have luggage, the subway is difficult to negotiate because there are lots of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: melofun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was bad from the minute we arrived there, the door was close, because the hotel was in construction, we have to go inside from the Memphis hotel, the people in the front desk don't even said hello, not help us in anything. after we booking we went to the room, we have to go to the other side of the Memphis hotel and the walls where all derty, the room are small and the noise was terrible we can't sleep for two night and we stay there for 3 night, our room was in the back of the hotel ugly and derty view. When we check out they even want it we paid the hotel again, but finally they let us go and said they will checking in the account, but we have to give them our credit card number. We never stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Piqua41
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of it all in Madrid, choose this Tryp. Our room looked out over the Spanish equivalent of Times Square, but with such triple-glazed windows that we didn't hear a thing! Also, the windows open for fresh air and wine bottle storage! :) Freshly redecorated in 2000, great front desk staff, and lots of top drawer amenities make this a definite pick for Madrid. Also, 30% off nearby underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a trip to Spain and spent three nights at the Tryp Washington, selected after using TripAdvisor. It was just as I was led to expect. The location was great for my purposes. I could easily walk to the pickup point for tours ( near the Palacio Real) and had a good variety of restaurants to choose from within a five minute walk. Although I didn't use it, there is a Metro stop nearby as well. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and quiet; and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The renovations are still going on so I had to use the lobby of the Tryp Menfis, attached to the Washington. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: JodieBath
Reviews.Content: have just got back from a Fantastic short break to Madrid and 4 nights in Tryp Washington Hotel. Excellent hotel, spotlessly clean, rooms fantastic with lovely bathroom and comfortable living space. Fanastic room with a balony overlooking the amazing Gran Via. Would definately reccommend. A jewel of a hotel in a crowd of many!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had originally organised to stay at the Asturias in Madrid, but after reading some reviews I decided to upgrade to The Washington. I booked the hotel through lastminute and got a reasonable price. However lastminute failed to state that the hotel was undergoing major renovation, and that the hotel Washington was not actually in use. When we arrived the hotel was blacked out, covered in scaffolding with not a soul to be found. We had to make our journey to the hotel through another hotel next door.(The two hotels appeared to be being merged). When we arrived at the hotel they had no record of our booking and we spent a long time trying to establish the problem (thank god my friend spoke Spanish). On our journey from reception to the room, there were various disappointing sights including holes in the celling and plaster board falling off the walls, and a very dodgy lift not very pleasant at all. When we arrived at the room our electricty had also failed. The staff were helpful with regards to this matter and the problem was sorted quickly. The rooms are of good size and the bathrooms are nice, we also had a balcony with a disappointing view over a side street. Some members of staff were extremly rude, including one who refused to let us leave our suitcases in reception after we had checked out. The day manager however was very nice and helped us with making various sightseeing arrangements. One positive thing about this hotel was that it was quiet, something hard to find in a bustling city. Great location, dont expect a high standard and be prepared for major renovations. Overall disappointing after reading such positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Iwas there last year & will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Is a pleasant hotel. The location is the best, is clean and the staff very profesional and accomodating. As a matter of fact I am planning on going back this March and I will stay in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: tour123
Reviews.Content: Tryp Washington and Menfis are twin hotels, but the former is by far the better one in spite of its (lesser) 3 star classification. Our room was impeccable, with completely new furniture and perfectly clean. Room size is average, but sufficient for 2 people. The location on Gran Via makes it the ideal place to stay for a tourist. We paid 70 euros a night at the end of November through a promotion from Sol Melia, and I consider this an excellent bargain. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Tryp Madrid Washington Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Gran Via 72, 28013 Madrid, Spain
